newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Pope John Paul begins two-day visit to Hungary.
newsitem.headline: Pope John Paul begins two-day visit to Hungary.

text.p: Pope John Paul arrived in Hungary on Friday for a two-day visit intended to highlight his drive for Christian unity in the approach to the year 2000.
The 76-year-old Pontiff looked in reasonable health as he walked steadily down the steps of the Alitalia plane to be greeted by Hungarian President Arpad Goncz.
Two young girls presented him with flowers in the Vatican colours of yellow and white. He did not kiss the ground, a regular feature of his trips, because this was his second visit to Hungary.

The Pope, who hopes to lead the Roman Catholic Church into the third millennium, is to attend a ceremony later on Friday marking the 1,000th anniversary of a Benedictine monastery at Pannonhalma in western Hungary.
On Saturday he is to celebrate a huge outdoor mass in the nearby city of Gyor, on the River Danube, and meet Hungarian bishops before returning to Rome that evening.
The trip, the Pope's 73rd abroad, follows a fresh scare about his health in mid-August when he entered hospital briefly for a battery of sophisticated medical tests.
